attributes.text: The context to use with the callback function

The context to use with the callback function
The context to use with the callback function
The default value of the prompt textfield
Shortcut for prompt dialog. The value argument was forgotten in the initial implementation and comes last for backwards compatibility. This might change in a future release.
The context to use with the callback function
Enforce the use of a coloured blocker. Added for backwards-compability with pre-1.2 versions
The context to use with the callback function
If you supply a map, all the corresponding properties will be set. If a string is given, use it as to set the ‘message’ property.
Create a cancel button, which is hidden by default and will be shown if allowCancel property is set to true.
Create the content of the dialog. Extending classes must implement this method.
Handle click on cancel button. Calls callback with an “undefined” argument
Handle click on ok button. Calls callback with a “true” argument

Returns the (computed) value of the property allowCancel.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowCancel}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property blockerColor.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #blockerColor}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property blockerOpacity.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #blockerOpacity}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property callback.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #callback}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property cancelOnEscape.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #cancelOnEscape}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property context.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #context}.
Returns the widgets that is the container of the dialog

Returns the (computed) value of the property image.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #image}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property message.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #message}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property show.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #show}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property useBlocker.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useBlocker}.
Hide the widget. Overriding methods must call this parent method. Returns the widget instance for chaining.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property allowCancel with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowCancel}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property blockerColor with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #blockerColor}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property blockerOpacity with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #blockerOpacity}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property callback with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #callback}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property cancelOnEscape with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #cancelOnEscape}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property context with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property image with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property message with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #message}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property show with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #show}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property useBlocker with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useBlocker}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property allowCancel equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowCancel}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property cancelOnEscape equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #cancelOnEscape}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property show equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #show}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property useBlocker equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useBlocker}.
A promise that resolves with the result of the dialog action

Resets the user value of the property allowCancel.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowCancel}.

Show the widget. Overriding methods must call this parent method. Returns the widget instance for chaining.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property allowCancel.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #allowCancel}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property cancelOnEscape.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #cancelOnEscape}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property show.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #show}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property useBlocker.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useBlocker}.
Callback function that will be called when the user has interacted with the widget. See sample callback method supplied in the source code of each dialog widget.
Whether to triger the cancel button on pressing the “escape” key (default: true). Depends on the ‘allowCancel’ property.
A banner image/logo that is displayed on the widget, if applicable
Whether the dialog is shown. If true, call the show() method. If false, call the hide() method.
Whether to block the ui while the widget is displayed
Dispatched when user clicks on the “Cancel” Button
Fired on change of the property {@link #allowCancel}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #show}.
Dispatched when user clicks on the “OK” Button
